dxf2svg
Class StyleSheetGenerator

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.StyleSheetGenerator
public final class StyleSheetGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

This class will generate internal or external style sheets for SVG depending on the stylesheet option switch on the command line. If the user wants to use style sheets then this class will:

1) test for existing css directory
2) test for existing svg.css in that directory
3) if both test are false and MAKE_CSS is true write to file a standard set of Spar styles.

If the user wants to include styles in the SVG file then:
1) an external class will call the makeStyle() method which will place style info into a string and return it to the caller to be appended to the SVG (in DTD.append()).
2) for special cases like linetypes that are NOT "Bylayer" use a method that will return a string that contains the correct CSS over-riding info contained in a 'style' attribute. like: style="stroke-dasharray:10 2".

Adobe also allows the user to determine if the styles should be entity attributes or declared style attributes at the start of the file.

Version:
1.60 - October 30, 2002
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Method Detail

setLayerInfo

public void setLayerInfo(java.util.Hashtable layers)
This method takes the layer information collected from TableProcessor and makes a new list of the names of the layers for other steps in the conversion. This method should only be called once.

This method also checks to see if the default language layer has been found because if a DXF has notes but does not have a default language layer i.e. there is a NOTENUM layer but not 't' layer then this method will search for the default target layer (no matter what it was set to with '-default_target_note_layer_name') so when text has to be moved, there is a layer to move it to, otherwise you get a NullPointerException as text objects test for line type with getLineTypeNameByLayer(java.lang.String).

getLayerNames

public void getLayerNames(java.util.Vector nameList)
Returns the names of all the layers in the original DXF in the form of a Vector.

Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the names are requested before the layer information is parsed from the DXF.
See Also:
setLayerInfo(java.util.Hashtable)

setLineTypeInfo

public void setLineTypeInfo(java.util.Hashtable linets)
Allows passing of line type information

setStylesInfo

public void setStylesInfo(java.util.Hashtable styles)
Allows passing of styles information from table processor. This method also updates the styles based on the content of the textStyle values stored in the config.d2s if any.

getStyle

public TableStyles getStyle(java.lang.String style_name)
Returns a 'TableStyles' object requested by name. With SvgGraphicElements the objects query the StyleSheetGenerator for TableLayers information for comparison. SvgText objects just request a copy of their TableStyles table and query the data they need. This in the long run is cheaper because you just query the HashMap once for the table and then all the rest of the queries are calls to local objects. In the final analysis layer information is brokered by StyleSheetGenerator and Styles are handled by the text objects themselves. This may change in the future.

Parameters:
style_name - name of the style
Returns:
TableStyles
Throws:
StyleSheetGenerator.UndefinedTableException - if the style table is null.

addAttdef

public void addAttdef(SvgAttdef sa)
This method allows DXF attribute definition objects to be passed for reference by SvgAttrib objects.

This method will not add this SvgAttdef if another with the same values already exists. see SvgAttdef.equals(java.lang.Object) for what equals means.

getLineType

public java.lang.String getLineType(java.lang.String name,
                                    double scale)
Retrieves any LineTypeTable as requested by name and set scale

Parameters:
name - of line type required.
scale - of line pattern.
Returns:
LineTypeTable converted to String.
Throws:
StyleSheetGenerator.UndefinedTableException - if the line type table is null.

getLineType

public java.lang.String getLineType(java.lang.String name,
                                    double scale,
                                    java.lang.String style)
Pass back any LineTypeTable as requested by name, any scale and by prefered output style.

This method is used when you have the unique case of an object whose lineType differs from it's layer's lineType. You request the special option of as_attribute and you will get the LineTypeTable as an attribute value.

Parameters:
name - of the line type required
scale - of the line's pattern.
style - controls if the toString() method of the LineTypeTable outputs its data in "as_attribute" format.
Throws:
StyleSheetGenerator.UndefinedTableException - if the line type table is null.

getLineTypeNameByLayer

public java.lang.String getLineTypeNameByLayer(java.lang.String LayerName)
This method is called by an SvgGraphicElement as soon as its layer name has been established.

Parameters:

Returns:
line type name by layer i.e. CONTINUOUS.
Throws:
StyleSheetGenerator.UndefinedTableException - if the layer table is null.

getLayerFill

public int getLayerFill(java.lang.String layerName)
This method will return the fill for a layer. This is the colour of the layer, but with Dxf2Svg you are not restricted to that colour. You can specify a specific fill that is different from the stroke of an object. This is not possible in AutoCAD but it is possible through the config.d2s file. See Sally documentation for details under the topic of layerStyle.

One condition where this would be helpful is if there were elements on a layer that has a hydraulic line on it. any of the entities like lines or text could be rendered in black through the use of the config.d2s's layerStyle command and the fill of solids like the fill of the hydraulic line would appear in the correct colour for the layer say AutoCAD colour CY.

getLayerIsVisible

public boolean getLayerIsVisible(java.lang.String LayerName)
This looks up a layers visibility based on whether it was frozen, locked (invisible or false) or neither (visible or true).

Returns:
boolean true if layer visible or false if invisible
Throws:
StyleSheetGenerator.UndefinedTableException - if the layer table is null.

hasLayer

public boolean hasLayer(java.lang.String layerName)
This method returns true if the drawing has the argument layer, false other wise. The look up is case insensitive and does not require the 'st' prefix.

isLangSwitchRequired

public boolean isLangSwitchRequired()
